0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify and verify documentation submitted for customs clearance, such as shipping documents, invoices, and certificates of origin.
Ensure compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and tariffs related to international trade.
Conduct inspections of goods and equipment to ensure they are accurately declared and in compliance with regulations.
Process and clear shipments through customs, including obtaining necessary permits and licenses.
Research and stay up-to-date on changes in laws, regulations, and policies affecting imports and exports.
Negotiate and resolve disputes related to shipment delays, missing documentation, or other issues.
Maintain accurate records and reports of all shipments, including import/export statistics and customs clearance data.
Collaborate with shipping carriers, warehouses, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth and efficient customs clearance processes.
Evaluate and interpret data from various sources, such as Customs Automated Systems (CAS) and trade databases, to inform business decisions.
Develop and implement effective strategies for improving customs clearance efficiency and reducing delays.
Provide training and guidance to employees on customs regulations, procedures, and best practices.
Conduct risk assessments and provide recommendations to mitigate potential risks associated with international trade.
Maintain relationships with government agencies, regulatory bodies, and other stakeholders to stay informed about changes in laws and regulations.
Analyze and interpret data from business intelligence tools and reports to inform business decisions and optimize operations.
Develop and implement policies and procedures for handling special goods, such as hazardous materials or restricted items.
Stay up-to-date on changes in trade agreements, tariffs, and other factors that may impact imports and exports.
Collaborate with suppliers and manufacturers to ensure compliance with export regulations and obtain necessary certificates of origin.
Process and clear shipments for diplomatic and government agencies, including obtaining necessary permits and licenses.
Maintain accurate records of shipping documentation, including commercial invoices, bills of lading, and packing lists.
Develop and implement effective strategies for managing and mitigating the risk of theft, counterfeiting, and other forms of trade fraud.
Analyze and interpret data from various sources to identify trends and patterns in import/export activity, and provide recommendations for business improvement.
1: Develop and implement new training programs to enhance employees' skills and knowledge.
Conduct needs assessments to identify training gaps and tailor programs accordingly.
Design and deliver presentations, workshops, and other training sessions for diverse audiences.
Create and disseminate training materials, such as manuals, guides, and online resources.
Identify internal and external resources that can be leveraged to support training initiatives.
Collaborate with subject matter experts to create high-quality content and curriculum.
Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs using various metrics and methods.
Develop and manage training budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources.
Recruit, train, and retain a team of instructional designers and trainers to support program delivery.
Establish and maintain relationships with vendors, partners, and stakeholders to identify new training opportunities.
Analyze data and insights from training evaluations to inform future program development and improvements.
2: Prepare high-quality meals in a timely manner for large groups of people.
Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment to ensure food safety.
Follow recipes and cooking instructions provided by chefs or supervisors.
Order supplies and ingredients for the cafeteria or institution's food service program.
Clean and sanitize all equipment, utensils, and work surfaces in the kitchen.
Prepare specialty dishes such as desserts, salads, or international cuisine for special events or celebrations.
Monitor inventory levels of ingredients and supplies to minimize waste and optimize usage.
Collaborate with other cooks, chefs, and food service staff to plan menus and coordinate events.
Follow proper food safety and handling procedures to prevent contamination and ensure customer safety.
Maintain accurate records of food costs, inventory, and sales to help manage the cafeteria's budget.
Provide excellent customer service by taking orders, serving meals, and responding to customer requests.
Stay up-to-date with changes in food trends, nutrition, and regulations to provide healthy and appealing menu options.
